definition: flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
grass radical 草字頭兒|草字头儿[cao3 zi4 tou2 r5]
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]
pattern/way of doing sth/trick/(sports) fancy-style (as figure skating etc)
the Stars and Stripes (US flag)/by extension, the United States of America/abbr. for Citibank 花旗銀行|花旗银行
Songhua River in Jilin province 吉林省 through Harbin 哈尔滨, a tributary of Heilongjiang 黑龍江|黑龙江

sentences.english: Who would have thought a pansy could be such a naughty little flower.
sentences.chinese: 誰曾想到一三色堇可能是這樣一個頑皮的花。

sentences.english: The interviewer spends a lot of time answering your questions.
sentences.chinese: 面試官花大批時間答覆你的問題。

sentences.english: A northern brutal muscular Lan lives to spend a not intentional waist.
sentences.chinese: 北野烈一把攬住花無心的腰。

sentences.english: The South Korean government spends millions promoting contemporary Korean culture abroad.
sentences.chinese: 韓國政府花了數百萬的錢推廣當代韓國文化。

sentences.english: Do you think it's worth paying so much for designer products?
sentences.chinese: 你覺得爲設計師的產品花那麼多錢值得嗎？

sentences.english: Mrs. Black spent all her money betting on horses.
sentences.chinese: 布萊克夫人把她所有的錢都花在了賭馬上。

sentences.english: This is a flower familiar to many of us.
sentences.chinese: 這是我們都很熟悉的一種花。

sentences.english: My younger sister. Look at your dirty face.
sentences.chinese: 我的小姑子呀，你看這小臉花的。

sentences.english: Thank the interviewer for taking the time to speak with you.
sentences.chinese: 對面試官花時間表示感謝。

sentences.english: My garden was covered with so many butterflies that I could hardly see the flowers.
sentences.chinese: 我的花園裏飛舞着很多蝴蝶，我幾乎看不見花了。

sentences.english: If you spend long hours at work a dog is not for you.
sentences.chinese: 如果你花長時間在上班那你就不適合養狗。

sentences.english: The buttercup is a wild plant with bright yellow cup - shaped flowers.
sentences.chinese: 毛茛是一種野生植物，開杯形黃色花。

sentences.english: Then I knew it was she who had put them there.
sentences.chinese: 然後我知道是她把那些花“放”在那兒的。

sentences.english: It took him quite some time to pick off the burs that had stuck to his coat.
sentences.chinese: 花了好長時間他才把粘在衣服上的刺摘掉。

sentences.english: ChengKang found driving end be chafed, cognizance is concise.
sentences.chinese: 承康發現座駕車尾被擦花，認定是簡潔所爲。

sentences.english: Remember to spend a day in Central Park watching a play by Shakespeare in the open air.
sentences.chinese: 記得花一天時間在中央公園露天看莎士比亞的戲劇。

definition: coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
to blossom/see 著花|着花[zhao2 hua1]
to blossom/to come to flower/to be in bloom
to struggle to get free/to strive to acquire/to make (money)
to bloom/to blossom/to flower/fig. to burst open/to feel happy or elated/new development grows out
style of folk song popular in Gansu, Qinghai and Ningxia/CL:首[shou3]
